subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Christianity and Slavery
description: A micro-lesson that makes Christianity and Slavery usable.

hook.text: The Bible was used to justify slavery and to abolish it. Christians stood on both sides of history's worst moral crime.

buildup.text: Southern American churches cited scripture to defend slavery. 'Slaves, obey your masters' was their favorite verse.

discovery.text: But abolitionists were Christians too. William Wilberforce and Harriet Tubman fought slavery as a religious duty.

twist.text: The same Bible, read differently, produced slaveholders and liberators. Scripture is a mirror, not a manual.

climax.text: Christianity's role in slavery shows that religion amplifies human choices. It doesn't make them for us.

punchline.text: The Bible justified slavery and ended it. Scripture is a mirror, not a manual.

quiz.question: How did Christianity relate to slavery?
